job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly relates to improving and managing the processes involved in the ML lifecycle, which falls under MLOps.
While broad, in the context of an MLOps Engineer role, this implies enabling faster iteration and deployment of ML models, a core MLOps function.
Supporting multiple teams with their ML operations indicates a platform-level responsibility, aligning with MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: provide support to our R&D Researchers in all aspects of the MLOps lifecycle
job_tasks.justification: This is a direct statement of responsibility for the MLOps lifecycle, encompassing all its stages.

job_tasks.phrase: help establish general coding standards when it comes to ML and MLOps
job_tasks.justification: Establishing coding standards is a software engineering practice that ensures code quality and maintainability, even within an MLOps context.

job_tasks.phrase: Assist R&D Researchers with fixing issues with their current setups (this includes troubleshooting, integrating CI/CD etc.)
job_tasks.justification: Troubleshooting and integrating CI/CD are core MLOps responsibilities focused on operational efficiency and deployment automation.

job_tasks.phrase: Help define our "1 click process" to create custom services and data-pipelines
job_tasks.justification: Defining automated processes for service and data pipeline creation is a key MLOps task aimed at streamlining workflows.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement new tooling in the areas of orchestration, experiment tracking, service deployment, Infrastructure as Code
job_tasks.justification: These are all specific MLOps functions: orchestration (e.g., Airflow), experiment tracking (e.g., MLflow), service deployment, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

job_tasks.phrase: Conduct research & implement ways to improve standardisation of environments across R&D Teams
job_tasks.justification: Improving environment standardization is crucial for reproducible ML workflows and operational stability, falling under MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Create / Improve infrastructure for Github Actions
job_tasks.justification: Github Actions is a CI/CD tool, and improving its infrastructure for ML workflows is an MLOps task.

job_tasks.phrase: Improve Template capabilities - you will be in charge of our basic ML repository
job_tasks.justification: Managing and improving ML repositories and templates is part of establishing standardized and efficient ML development practices, fitting within MLOps.

soft_skills.justification: Supporting multiple teams implies a need for effective communication and collaboration to understand their diverse needs and provide assistance.

soft_skills.phrase: Now we want to streamline the process, adopt the right tools and super-charge the work we are doing.
soft_skills.justification: The desire to streamline, adopt new tools, and improve processes indicates a need for continuous learning and adaptability to new technologies and methodologies.

soft_skills.phrase: Assist R&D Researchers with fixing issues with their current setups (this includes troubleshooting, integrating CI/CD etc.)
soft_skills.justification: Troubleshooting and fixing issues requires strong problem-solving skills.

soft_skills.phrase: you will be in charge of our basic ML repository.
soft_skills.justification: Being 'in charge' of a repository implies taking ownership and responsibility for its management and improvement.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on MLOps tasks, which fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering) as defined in the coding book. Specifically, tasks like streamlining ML development, supporting MLOps lifecycles, implementing CI/CD, orchestration, experiment tracking, deployment, and IaC are all core MLOps functions. While the role supports research teams and involves ML, it does not specify any tasks related to the development or fine-tuning of generative AI models (like LLMs, RAG, prompt engineering). The emphasis is on the operational and engineering aspects of making ML work efficiently and reliably. Therefore, it aligns best with a 'Core ML Engineer' profile, which involves a balanced mix of A and B tasks, but with a focus on traditional ML operations rather than GenAI specialization.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the MLOps responsibilities. It explicitly mentions MLOps lifecycle, CI/CD, orchestration, experiment tracking, deployment, and IaC, which are all well-defined categories within the coding book. There is no ambiguity regarding the core focus of the role being on the operational and engineering aspects of ML, rather than on the development of AI models themselves or GenAI specific tasks.
